website_summaries.verdict: Bright mesh screen, sturdily built, quality finished, and available to fit a wide range of window sizes.
pros: Mesh screen which comes in heights of 10, 15, 18, and 24 inches, and range from 15- to 45-inch adjustable widths
Rails are galvanized, and wood ends are varnished for protection and a nicely finished look
Screens are solidly machine-clamped into metal rails
Corners sturdily tenoned to keep the screen square
cons: Some purchasers experienced issues with the screen material tearing easily or becoming detached from the frame

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box one of the screens arrived pulled away from the frame so I applied tape to the side and the frame so no bugs could get through. The screens were really cheap so I guess I get what I paid for, but I needed screens for my windows since the building I live in doesn’t provide screens for it’s tenants and Home Depot is so far away. I wouldn’t really recommend these screens but if you’re really desperate and need something immediate and not opposed to using tape to fix the screens then these might work for you. If not, look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Danisha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted it wasn't broken and it's doing exactly what it's supposed to be doing. I got one at Home Depot the darn thing was all bent up and didn't work at all it was a completely different brand. This once sturdy and it's just perfect thank you so much. I am using mine lengthwise in my son's roomy. If you are a mom you know why my son needs to keep his window open!!.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and product label doesn't match actual dimensions
customer_reviews.text: If it was simply a matter of incorrectly labeling an item, I wouldn't be harsh reviewing this product because I understand that accidents and mislabeling happens. Unfortunately, the metal screen on this product was sent detached from the frame on one side, on both screens that I purchased, suggesting product quality appears to be consistently poor. While the label says that the dimensions are 18x25-45, it's actually 14x20-36. Needless to say, these items are being returned for refund. What a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: 😥😕☹️
customer_reviews.text: I expected poor quality for the price, and that's fine. The problem I have is the fact it came with holes in the screen, otherwise it would be 5 star. I don't like how mosquitos get in. Sad day for me. I only cried a little.. This time 😥☹️
customer_reviews.author: Sir Topham Hatt

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: You really do get what you pay for, but these do have a purpose. These are flimsy screens, made of cheap material and built with gaps between slats—they’re great for cabins and places where ventilation is a must and perfection isn’t a necessity. We have a large and a small screen. These aren’t a security feature. They’re easily removed by a child. I wouldn’t use where a small child or pet could fall from a window. That said, we love them. They’re easy-to use, light-weight, and expandable. We found hard to find sizes. They keep flies, bees, and mosquitos out. They’re cheap and easy to install, and arrived overnight. Thrilled so far. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: jael

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk and does not match the dimesions on the label
customer_reviews.text: The label says it expands between 25-45 inches, but it does not expand past 25 inches. But even if it did, it is made out of such cheap material that i don't think it would last a single summer. Also, now that I see the reviews, 16% of those who review this product say that the product is total JUNK. The word JUNK is used in almost every review. And yet Amazon gives this product 4 out of 5 stars!!! When 16% of the people say its junk, how could it get 4 stars? What does it take for a product to get 1 or 2 stars at Amazon?? Very disappointed in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: AlmostModo

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product and does what I needed them to do
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three screens in the same size. Bought them to put in the second story windows so the cats can't push the screens out. They fit nicely inside the window frame and are out of the way so the cats can still sit on the window sills. Only giving four stars because on one of the screens the mesh screen is not fully secured inside the wood frame. Not worth the hassle of returning. I am ordering three more screens but in a shorter height for when we don't want the windows open all the way. If I had thought about that before ordering, I would have only ordered shorter screens.
customer_reviews.author: nordbych

customer_reviews.title: Removable screens are fragile, so be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is exactly as described. However, understand going in that these kinds of screens are, by their very nature, more susceptible to damage than the full-size screens that come with windows. They must be handled carefully to prevent pulling the screen material from the frame. That said, these are excellent examples of this sort of screen. Easy to install, quick to remove if it rains, keeps the bugs out. Measure your windows carefully and pick the right size for your needs and these work great. Don't expect them to last for years, but even the expensive ones don't last longer.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price with gentle handling
customer_reviews.text: I like the price. And the concept. But... it was packed in a flimsy oversized box that caused damage to the screens little holes from corners and dents in metal part that keeps it from being adjustable. Plus the label is tucked in with the screen so when tugged off, it pulls the screen out and away from wood portion. It’s all fixable so I’m not returning. If they loosen the labels and package a little more snugly, these problems could be avoided. On the plus side, even with these problems, I can afford to purchase and fix whereas other brands are way out of my financial budget.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect screen for a condo window. My windows are quite wide (47"), so this adjustable screen was the answer. I do have the screens that came with the condo/windows. The original screens are a pain in the butt to put in and take out....they also harbor bugs in the sides. This adjustable screen is great since I don't really open my windows that often, but when I do, I can chose when and how long to have them open. Great idea and a super product.
customer_reviews.author: phantom girl

customer_reviews.title: I won against my cat’s destructive behavior!
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Carlos, in his fervor to escape & go after an outside lizard, often popped out the screen’s spline & escaped. Again & again I put the screen back in & he did this so often, I had to resort to using Gorilla glue on the spine& he still escaped! So I bought one of these mini screens as an experiment & it worked!!! He tried to pull it back but I put double stick tape on the ends so he was stopped in his efforts! Ha! So I bought more mini screens for the rest of the patio windows. I won this battle against my escape artist.
customer_reviews.author: Shashadow1

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding price for a simple solution to get fresh air without bugs
customer_reviews.text: We have a small guest house with no screens yet on its windows. We stumbled across this product and thought to give it a try. So glad we did! It's perfect. It slides to accommodate a range of window widths and at 10-inches tall, it allows in more than enough air. And it's so light and compact that when a guest doesn't want fresh air (without bugs), they can remove the screen in an instant. We don't have pets so we expect this to last a long while. We'd buy again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly the quality I expected for the $7 price tag. The screen did immediately start pulling away from the wood frame as soon as I got it out of the box but I had anticipated this after reading the other reviews. I put a line of E6000 all along the edges where the screen meets the frames on both sides and allowed it to dry. I haven't had any issues since. My kids haven't been able to break them so that's a big plus. I wouldn't recommend leaving them in the windows while it rains as they will rust.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I guess if you're using this horizontally, you'll do fine, but vertically, not so much. It will simply drop at the slightest touch or vibration. This is a lesson I seem to be incapable of learning. So while I give this middling stars, I have to give myself one star or less! The last bargain was in 1948 when I bought 1sq. inch of Alaska for 10 cents or maybe a quarter but I never figured out where it was or what I could do with it!!! At any rate, however used, this screen has a life span of maybe 6 months
customer_reviews.author: Barry A. Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: We use these in several of our windows that typically have AC units during the summer months, rather than wrestle getting the full screens inserts back in place. They do a good job keeping the bugs out, are easy to put in and take out. We usually keep both a big one and smaller one available at each window. I've found their ability to keep bugs out is greatly improved if you get ones that are wider than you actually need, this gives you more overlap.
customer_reviews.author: UnregisteredTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good for price. Easy to use. Virtually universal.
customer_reviews.text: I own the small versions of these, so I knew what I was getting out of the large, but these came with, I'll say, "defective" tags. The labels were built into the screen sides (pushed in past the perferation on the tag), so the screen was pulled out of the casing when trying to remove the label. I ended up having to pull quite a chunk of screen out in order to fully remove the tag. I was able to force the screen back into the casing with a card, but the corner of the screen is now slightly loose and misshapen.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: no damage  upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: My second attempt at a review! First review did not show up. It went well. No rips no problems. It is exactly what I wanted. I purchased these once before many years ago, but after a long time they rusted and got very dirty- we leave then in the windows. They worked well so I bought the same ones again. I guess that is a good review if you but the items not once but twice. Will they last forever? Maybe if you being them into the house after every rain/snow, but not if they are left in window.They are inexpensive so can just be replaced every few years.
customer_reviews.author: GDS

customer_reviews.title: Received with screen detached from frame so it will allow bugs through
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product. It's very flimsy and cheaply made, and the one I received is damaged. The screen has been pushed/pulled out of the frame on the inside part of one of the panes. There is no way to fix this without tearing the entire thing apart and it is definitely going to allow bugs to come into the house. If I wanted to fuss around with fixing this screen, I'd have made my own. You have to take care in handling this item or you will push or pull the screen out of the frame as it's not well secured.
customer_reviews.author: Karen V.

customer_reviews.title: Second screen arrived damagaed
customer_reviews.text: This is the second screen I've ordered and the second to arrive damaged. I've kept both screens since their main function in my home is as a barrier to keep my cats away from our window's build in fabric screens. If this was a primary screen I would not have kept it. That screen is cut too short for the built in latches and must easily become detached during transit. There is not enough overlap in the screen to reattach by hand. Note that the boxes containing the screens arrive completely undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: The Warped One

customer_reviews.title: Works for what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the highest quality. The screen was coming apart from the aluminum pretty much the minute we opened. It's in in the middle, though. Because of how it's designed with the screen overlap in the middle, it doesn't make this unusable. It still allows us to have the window open where we feed the birds without using a traditional screen and the overlap makes up for where the screen detaches from the frame. It was not expensive and it does the job we bought it for, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Vogel

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT AND GOOD QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I am honestly quite impressed with this screen as it seems to be much better quality than the original screen we had on the window which broke and deteriorated over time. I bought this so I could air out a room in the house while keeping out critters and because we live in the South, the winter season is the only time we can really get away with opening windows. The screen was easy to install and fits perfectly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew this product existed 2 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our house 2 years ago and of course the only window in the house that didn't have a screen was our son's room. There was only one other window that had the same sized screen and we weren't willing to part with it. If I had known that these things existed sooner, he could've had fresh air long ago! This thing is great! It's one of the larger windows in the house, with it being 44" wide, so the varying size options was fantastic. I've had this in for a week and it fits in there really well. I am so excited to have found this. Thank you, once again, Amazon. Great solution at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Decent solution
customer_reviews.text: My office has 18" windows and this is a hard window screen size to find. the 10 x 15-25 Frost King was the only one in those dimensions and was available as an add on item for under five dollars. At that price it is hard to criticize and build quality is fair for the price. Be aware though that the wooden ends are thicker than some other screen inserts and do not insert into my window guides. So they are kept in place entirely by the downward pressure of the window sash. Also there are no gaskets on any side so there are air gaps. I will probably add some glue on foam.
customer_reviews.author: jamdo63

customer_reviews.title: Saves me from the mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Use this in my apartment which has large windows but no screens. Very happy! Gives me the airflow without the threat of being eaten to death at night by a little mosquito intruder. Great product, significantly better construction than Saint Gobain version. Less flimsy frame and also more transparent than other versions. Nice product for the price - would opt for the larger 21-37 if your window can fit it (plus it's half the price of the 19-33 inch version)
customer_reviews.author: randumtasx

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: These screens are perfect for windows that don't have screens or are an odd size. They slide fairly easy to adjust the size. They aren't the most sturdy screens ever built but are definitely enough to get the job done. They keep out insects and should last a few years with normal use. Plus you really can't beat the price. I use mine in the basement windows that are not standard size. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the money - even if only a penny!
customer_reviews.text: What an piece of crap! The screen actually had a hole in it and was pulled out of the ends in two places. Yes, it is very flimsy, I was aware of that. But for my use it would suffice. But when I pay even this small amount for something, I still expect it to arrive it new condition. There was no damage to the box, so it was obviously damaged before it was even placed in the box. I mean, seriously......? And I have pictures if you want to see them.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Anthony

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it 0 stars I would
customer_reviews.text: This screen is junk. I opened the box and the screen was already coming out the frame. Them I wanted to make sure it fit and the frame will not extend. Very poor Quality. So I received my replacement today and guess what... the screen was coming out the frame just like the first , but this on did expand. I’m so very disappointed I really thought I found the right one. I guess no one does QC before it goes out or if you see it’s a replacement from a defective order make sure it’s good. I spent hours looking for a screen.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Best of this type I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this type of screen for years, for my 150 year old rowhouse in a designated historic neighborhood which technically doesn't allow standard storm window/screens on fronts of the beautiful old buildings. NONE of this type of screen will last for decades. This is the best one I've ever purchased and at a bargain price compared to the expensive hardward store in the neighborhood. I will be buying more of these. If you are used to this type of screen, this is a good one -- the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Vuvuzela

customer_reviews.title: NOT SUITABLE FOR CATS!
customer_reviews.text: If you are using these to protect kids or cats from getting out, look elsewhere. My cats are not even one year old yet (still kittens!!) and one of them managed to slide the screen open and get out onto the fifth floor fire escape, fortunately our neighbour managed to catch him outside his window. Needless to say the screens went straight in the bin! I'm going to look into installing an actual grill.
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Overall good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and fits well in the window as expected worth NO gaps. Screen and frame seem well made. Only issue is when you slide to fit the window it catches and you have to use some effort to make it slide. If your using it for the same window or same size window and you dont have to slide it much, this is likely to not even be an issue. Overall satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: alvins

customer_reviews.title: Extra Screen Window Protection
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I got it for my puppy as I keep the windows open and was worried he would just fall through the 2nd floor window as my bed is under the window. I ordered this and it goes right in the window perfectly in front of the other screen and is strong. I can confidently keep the fresh air flowing without worrying about my baby basset hound tumbling down onto deck below.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine McAdam

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. When I lived in NYC I had these types of screens all the time. You need them for the windows leading to the fire escapes. Because you aren't allowed to put a permanent screen on such windows. But those were sturdy and lasted for years. These broke immediately on the first attempt to install them. I looked around the internet. And it doesn't seem anyone makes any that are sturdier. Guess I have to hit the thrift stores. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Review Robot

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Simple Screen
customer_reviews.text: This adjustable screen is extremely simple and quick to install. Initially, I purchased one to test. It worked well and I then purchased another. The only reason for four stars is the one screen had sides that were slightly warped. It created a slight gap between the window and edge of the frame. The other screen fit well enough. In considering the great price and ease of use for these screens, I definitely consider the purchase worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Spring 101

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, portable and affordable window screen
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable, portable and lightweight, this window screen is well made. You can paint the wood to match your window. I ordered 3 and all arrived in good condition. Very well packaged. Now I can have nice cool air circulating in the house during the fall and winter months in SC. May need more for summer time but will wait to see if the 3 will be enough. Happy and satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: should have just bought from the local hardware store
customer_reviews.text: They took forever to get them! It was unbelievably long and I'm not sure if it was the seller or UPS but I purchased these so I could open my windows and half the summer went by waiting for them to come. And this part was my fault but they are a few inches too tall so I was only able to use 1 and it isn't installed properly so I get bugs in the house :(
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy's Custom Creations

customer_reviews.title: Defective installation of screen from manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my windows, as I opened the plastic packaging they came in I seen that the screen was not installed correctly in two areas. One area was on the wooden side I easily fixed that by putting the screen into the wood slot but could not stretch it. The seplace was center metal frame shown in pictures I can not fix. On a good note they are easy to use and fit nicely. Durability is not there strong suit.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Should be 4 1/2 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Nice screen for the price. Better than I expected. The only negative is a very very small space along the sides. It doesn't hug the window frame tightly and will most likely allow some tiny bugs in. I will most likely add a foam type strip along the sides which will correct the problem. Other than that I'm very happy with the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Granny's Purse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! These are great for renters
customer_reviews.text: I'm a renter, and my bedroom doesn't have any screens in the windows. It gets insanely hot in the summer, but apparently window screens are all made-to-fit. This is the perfect solution for just make the bottom portion of your window screened-in. This couldn't be simpler to install and it seems well-made. I'll update if anything goes wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Adultman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. I don’t know how all the other reviews could possibly claim this is good quality. The screen is loose around the steel frame and I could bend the frame almost as easily as bending cardboard. Does not slide smoothly (due to the flimsy frame). I wouldn’t trust it to keep a mouse out of he house let alone my cat from getting out
customer_reviews.author: DerpyDoda

customer_reviews.title: Old windows solution
customer_reviews.text: I live in an old log home. Some windows were replaced. Others weren't. This is the perfect size for me to open my window all the way and have a screen. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a low price
customer_reviews.text: It's somewhat flimsy, but I expected that foe the price. It does expand well & fits nicely in my window! I will not be leaving this in my window year round like some other reviewers- I live in the Midwest & need my storm windows closed tightly, so only had it in appx 3 months- no problems. Took it out for the winter & is still in great shape. Personally, in my case, I think it will last several years. You have to figure, even if you only get 2-3 years out of it, it was worth the $15 price. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: As a renter this has been a nice solution for our apartment windows. It's easy to put in place and provides a good barrier. Its nice to get some fresh air in the place without the worry of bugs flying in.
customer_reviews.author: Val Kilmer's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fresh air
customer_reviews.text: Fresh air finally!!! I need to get my bedroom window screens repaired because they have holes in them, until I can get them repaired I decided to take them out so it won’t look like I’m living in the dumps! Lol... Anyway, this will definitely do the job until I can get to a hardware store. Also, to have new screens put in the frame is way more than what I paid for this!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Black

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but effective
customer_reviews.text: I just got this screen. When removing the paper tag, it removed a part of the screen from the frame. The screen is not well secured in the frame which why 3 stars. The screen functions well, simple and easy to install, resize and it does the job. The wooden frame is well made, but the screen is not well secured in that wood and metal frame. Fair price.
customer_reviews.author: JMN48236

customer_reviews.title: Simple cheap and reliable for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: Our last apartment had a bunch of these already in the windows and we loved having them. Our next place lacked though so we needed to find a sturdy one for a good price. This was a wonderful find. Installed in moments and relatively unobtrusive. Thankfully it is tall enough to keep the window open wide for the summer breeze to blow through.
customer_reviews.author: epop86

customer_reviews.title: Eh. They're okay. Better than some others.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these. The first 2 came in and they were both defective. Decided I would give it another shot and ordered replacements. They both came in fine. They don't open/close smoothly and it is wire mesh screening which I didn't notice originally. They will work to keep flies out, but the mesh holes are larger than all my window screens. Hopefully, they will open/close better when secured into place better. What I do like is that these share a track instead of being held together by a couple plastic clips.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. See the other glowing reviews. Just keep in mind that in many installations, it will be necessary to seal the top of the screened open window to keep out all the bugs. A piece of foam rubber or good old duct tape should work. If there is a way in, those flying bugs will find it! Install the adjustable screen and then think like a bug! You'll see what I mean about sealing the top of the open window.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these window screens from various other sources but none compare to the quality of this purchase. The screen is a true glider - doesn't stick midway as others have - the wood gives a clean look and the height is perfect. I couldn't wait to place one into the window and to my delight, this was the one to stay with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Maven

customer_reviews.title: Slightly flimsy, but functional
customer_reviews.text: The metal parts of this screen feel fairly cheap, and they two parts don't slide very freely, but once installed it stays put. I've had this in my window during the summer months for a couple years, and it works well for that. I put some foam tape in the gaps to block critters from getting in around the edges, but overall it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Chutuk

customer_reviews.title: Great Temporary Screen for people who live in old apartment buildings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Frost King Adjustable Window Screen for my living room and bedroom windows that have air conditioner units installed. I leave my ac units in all year round and needed a small screen to let fresh air in. The apartment building that I live in is old and has odd size windows, and difficult to find a temporary screen that would fit in my window. This one fit the bill. I would have given this a five star with the exception that one of the screens was slightly damaged, but can be fixed with cement glue. The seller delivered as promised and would purchase from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and well wrapped BUT came with 3 holes (seems like a common problem from other reviews). I’m betting that flies cannot fly through them (mosquitoes could but that’s not my problem). Does the job I need for the most part at a cheap price but the product is cheaply made and you get what you pay for. I’m keeping it because it’s not worth the hassle returning or exchanging.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Go to the store to check
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we moved into a new house and one of the screens was busted. I thought I'd buy one of these but when I got it, found that screen was smushed in on one side and uncovered. Unacceptable. Go to the store to check these for yourself; they are also poorly built. Money and time wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Audra

customer_reviews.title: perfect for narrow windows
customer_reviews.text: i have very narrow, old windows and wanted to find a screen that fit them. these are great. i did pull the screen out from its base while removing a sticker, but it went back in without a problem. my cat loves sitting at the window now! the price did drop dramatically after i ordered/paid for it, which is a little irritating but not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Yes, I can feel the breeze again!
customer_reviews.text: This screen works perfectly! After getting the run around from my super about replacing my screen I bought this and it serves its purpose. My window won’t close with the screen in, but it is beyond simple to take in and out and the coverage is good, no gaps, no bugs getting in, just fresh air. Exactly the solution I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: DawnieBK

customer_reviews.title: Not durable and made cheaply
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say but not a durable product at all. The nails started coming out before I could even use it. It’s a good idea in theory but the execution is poor. I won’t be returning it as it’s a bulky package and wasn’t that expensive. More hassle to return. Also if you do decide to buy make sure to measure up. The fitting has to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I think they are junk not great quality at all!!
customer_reviews.text: This screen is junk compared to this style of years ago. I didn't expect that quality but better than this is. The screen is difficult to open and doesn't do it smoothly. It will serve the purpose I bought it for so I am not returning it. You do get what you pay for in almost all cases and this is the truth.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Jackson

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap, but works
customer_reviews.text: For the $6 I paid for it, I'm happy...slapped some foam weatherstripping on the top/bottom and and does what I want it to...we only open the windows a few times/year, so rather than having spiders living between screen and window year round, I'll just put these in when we open the windows.
customer_reviews.author: jmb

customer_reviews.title: Functional and pretty darn big
customer_reviews.text: I like that this screen is fairly big, so my giant window gets to be open about 1/3 of the way, which is perfect. I like that it fits said giant window well and slots into the recesses of the window to prevent bugs from squeezing in. The screen isn't the most durable. With the first use, it was coming loose from the metal frame. I used some packing tape and fixed it. Other than that, no problems with it and it works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Boss Darcie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We do not have screens in the windows on the front of the house as I don't like the look of the typical window screen. I wanted to be able to open the window in my office on nice days without letting bugs in. This works perfectly. It is adjustable to fit the window well. I do have two dogs that sometimes push their nose against it and it doesn't move and the screen seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: RRMJR

customer_reviews.title: functions as it should
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it's supposed to do 🤷🏽‍♀️ No complaints...some have complained about a hole being there after the tag comes off, but if you don't yank it off violently it should be fine... Nice and tall too...the cat is happy too, it's about as tall as he is, so he has lots of room to look and he doesn't block the cool wind from coming in like the last screen thing I had which was smaller. I've had it for about a month now...no mosquitos, but little bugs. Yay 😊
customer_reviews.author: ntchana batoma

customer_reviews.title: The price is right, does the job, but very cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it does what it's supposed to do and doesn't look too cheap from afar. But if you put any stress on it besides the window sash sitting on it, do not expect it to hold up. I put my thumb through the corner of the screen pushing it into position. However, it does the job and I would happily buy another one, you really can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Crappy adjustable window screen....
customer_reviews.text: EXTREMELY SHODDY WORKMANSHIP!!! Put together in a very half-assed fashion!!! When I pulled the piece of paper off the screen came away from the frame!!! I actually took it apart n put it back together~BETTER THAN IT CAME TO ME!!! I WILL NOT purchase this again even tho I need 3 more.... I HAD to give 1 star even tho I did not even wanna give that!!! PiECE OF GARBAGE!!! STILL TRYING TO FIND MY CAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: dru

customer_reviews.title: Great when you have no screens!
customer_reviews.text: They fit great! And very convenient when my apartment doesn’t have screen in the windows which I though was very odd. But these will work on cool nights when I want the windows open. Can’t say how durable they will be as they did seem a little flimsy but when the window down on top they seem to be good.
customer_reviews.author: brneyes7190

customer_reviews.title: Livin breezy
customer_reviews.text: Slips right into the window space and adjusted to the width of my windows easily. I live in SE Texas where summer doesn't end until late November. My central AC went out for a week and I had no screens on the front two windows. Having a cross breeze through the house saved us from having to board far too many pets and abandon ship until replacement system was installed. As other reviewers have stated there are tiny gaps that small bugs could potentially enter through but I have a a lot of cats so that's just amusement for them until they kill it. So that's not really a problem for us.
customer_reviews.author: Lhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, no tools. I just needed an extra layer of screen to put in my windows where I have cat perches. Let's air in and provides a layer to keep bugs out and my cats safe. Inexpensive, nothing fancy. Probably would not use as my only screen, but good for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: lj113

customer_reviews.title: nothing to cut, nothing to trim simple to install.
customer_reviews.text: Frost King are the best go to company when you need nothing to cut, trim. Frost King company at amazon has the hard to find 10" inch window sliding screens. i couldn't find them anywhere and amazon has 'em. they're simple to maneuver and fit into place. Than You
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all my windows!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these screens, and they were exactly what I was looking for. I had a couple very old ones that needed to be replaced, so I was happy to get these because they adjust to fit either of the 2 different sized windows that needed them It sounds silly, but I already have regular screens in these windows, but I like to spread these across the bottom of the window because my big cat likes to sit in there, and I don't want him to fall through! These fit nicely and snugly into the grooves that are in the window frame.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: POORLY MADE, A WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Pulled them out of the plastic. One screen was okay. The other wasnt but I put them into the window. One came right apart from the wood frame on one side and the screen came out on the other side. Obviously a piece of junk. I still cannot even get the screen back into the frame. Needs Superman for that job.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Karp

customer_reviews.title: This is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few about 3 years ago. They were garbage by the end of the summer. I bought 2 more again at the beginning of last summer. I figured if I was really careful they might last a couple of years. Now I have more garbage. They just fall apart. Why don't they just charge us a little more and make them work
customer_reviews.author: ZeeK AzoiD

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 screens. 2 were no good. The screen was partially out of the frame. Of course they should be easy to install but they were so stuck you couldn't open them to size. My old ones were better. I gave 5 stars for easy to use only because any 2 year old could put a screen in a window. Northern N.E. is getting cold so I'll wait til next summer and find better quality ones.
customer_reviews.author: david froman

customer_reviews.title: No Leak Seal!
customer_reviews.text: This Frost King WB Marvin AW1047 window screen is better than others I've ordered for two antique arch-topped windows. It fits right up to the sill of the window and no mosquitoes come in at night. Other window screens I've purchased leave a gap which defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nagel

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a little bungalow i I live in that has really old screens that basically dont work. They're nice and sturdy and keep the bugs out and the air flowing. I bought some cushion tape to add to the sides for a better seal with the window.
customer_reviews.author: Hermione

customer_reviews.title: So Handy
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new house without screens. It looks great. Dirt doesn't build up in the windows. BUT no way to let in fresh air. Now, I really do have my cake and eat it too. My windows look great and I pop one in on beautiful days. We bought 2 for a cross breeze.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: Not aligned, but do the trick
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price. These screens do stick, and they're not perfectly aligned. Also, they're not straight! So if you have a groove that you are trying to fit them in, look elsewhere. They aren't going to fit. But if you have a wide window sill where you can fit them in, and where they are okay to be a bit crooked, then they're great! I wedge them in place and pull my window down on top of them to hold them up, and my cats aren't able to knock them down.
customer_reviews.author: slayj

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the bugs out!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a very old building with no screens in the windows & I always hated opening them because my office filled with flies and bees. Now I can put the screen in and open the window for some fresh air and I don't get bugs. Easy to use. Came well packaged. May get another one so I can open two windows.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Works well, frames can bend easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 because I have a cat who likes to claw my window screens. These are great as a barrier to the actual window screen. One thing I have found is that no matter where you buy these, they aren't att that sturdy, the framing metal bends easily...otherwise they work as intended. Best suggestion, buy on sale if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and design
customer_reviews.text: The screen was not attached to the frame in areas and made with cheap materials. The frame is too thick to fit in the grooves of a window, so it could only sit on the sill. It only slides horizontally and doesn’t have any way to hold it in place at any length, so it would not work in a vertical window space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for and I’m happy!
customer_reviews.text: They were a great price and I feel like for the price I should not complain. One is already broken because of putting it in and out of window daily. It bent. The other one that’s staying put in the window is fine. It was a good solution that didn’t cost a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Heitmann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping my fur babies safe!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats and a small 3rd floor apartment... I wanted to open the windows without fear they would rip the screens and fall out. These were the perfect solution! The cats are happy and safe and I can have fresh air and fall breezes!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry W

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I live in a loft building where I have 5ft wide windows, I use two in each window when I want to have them open. One of the four I purchased was a bit kinked and one was unbalanced. I purchased for use and not looks and they serve their purpose so at the end of the day they do what I need and really can't beat the cost.
customer_reviews.author: megan garrity

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product but was too small. That was likely my own error in not measuring correctly. I thought it was ok but slightly flimsy. When I stretched it out to capacity, I was not able to get it to go back to it's closed size.
customer_reviews.author: Jill V

customer_reviews.title: two defective ones in a row. Screen fabric pulled out from frame right out of box
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who designed these screens but the method for keeping the screen fabric into the frame is badly made. There is a metal frame piece where the mesh is sandwiched between that is only creased at intervals letting the fabric pull out. Destined to fail even if you manage to get one intact at the onset. Amazon should stop carrying these. I'm going to have to look for a different manufacturer with a better design...
customer_reviews.author: worker bee

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy and that's what matters
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I ordered, and it's well made. If only I had realized before ordering that while the window area is well over 18 in tall, the window itself only barely opens that wide. It was a struggle getting it in there, and while I know that's going to be a huge pain over time, the fact is it fits so close that no bugs can get in around it. So yeah.
customer_reviews.author: rbyteme

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected! Arrived fast, terrific price and product. I like that its 18" high, I basically got it to keep my indoor cat from jumping out the window, and with its height, he can comfortably sit up and look out and see the wildlife! Win Win
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: These screens are horrible do not buy, they came broken and all bend up. And they come out of there place the screens are poorly made. Do research before u choose these or go to ur discount store in ur neighborhood before u purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my house has the fancy tilting windows but NO SCREENS. I really wanted a way to let in fresh air without spending an arm and a leg. I saw this and decided to give it a try. It was so easy to install and so secure in my kitchen window that I am going to get a few more for the bedrooms to get ready for fall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Average window screen
customer_reviews.text: This is your basic old fashioned window screen. It works fine. There is one edge in the middle where the screen adjusts that isn't secured to the screen all the way, but this does not effect the function of the screen, or allow any insects to get in. The edge of the screen is also not sharp, so not a big deal to me. Of course, these portable screens don't protect against insects as well as installed screens do, but they keep most of them out. For myself, there aren't many flying bugs where I live, but I wanted screens to keep pigeons from straying in.
customer_reviews.author: JudithTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: the screens fit nicely. they are suprisingly well made for a lightweight
customer_reviews.text: the screens fit nicely. they are suprisingly well made for a lightweight , made in china product. When looking thru them they tend to "disappear" . one issue - when I pulled the label off of one ( out of 5 screens) of the screens it pulled the screen out of the groove it was in. it was a simple matter to push the screen back into the groove , but word to the wise - dont get too wild tearing the labels off.
customer_reviews.author: erin sanders

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. We have had these for about one month. Both have slipped out of the track as we attempted to open. I was able to repair one but the other screen failed as the screen section slipped out of the frame.
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: The house we're renting is missing a number of screens. I purchased four of these and they're great! Depending on the type (or maybe age?) of the windows you have you may need to lay a foam strip on the top of the screen frame. DO NOT ATTACH it or you won't be able to expand or condense the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Pam P

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap quality and had to fix it prior to using
customer_reviews.text: This product is very chincey and you have to be very delicate with it. Where the screen folds into the edges, mine was not when I took it out of the box. It had an exposed 2+” gap so I had to take a butter knife and gently push it back into the frame. Also, when expanding the screen you have to be really careful, if there is even the slightest bit of a wave in the screen then it won’t slide properly. It is currently serving its purpose but there were a lot of issues with it. But it was inexpensive and works now that I’ve fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: EMK

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these screens for my mom's home. I opened the box & both screens were warped. Where it was warped, the screen was not connected to the wood. VERY disappointed with the quality of these screens. I had to make the best of these for my mom to have a couple windows screened, but would not buy them again, or tell anyone to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great barrier between the cat & our sliding screen doors in the sunroom.
customer_reviews.text: These adjustable screens have worked well for us. Our cat loves the sunroom but has created some small holes in the screen doors when the glass sliding doors are open to let in the breeze. Bought these to put inside to serve as a buffer & protect the screen doors from her little paws when the glass doors are open. They have worked very well for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Dee M.

customer_reviews.title: Great little screens
customer_reviews.text: Our house we bought didn't have screens. Which we knew when buying it. Until we can afford to replace the windows, we bought these. They work surprisingly well. I love they can adjust. They are easy to put in the window and take out.
customer_reviews.author: GhostGurl

customer_reviews.title: With a little help it fits perfect! It keeps my cat in...lol
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 1930's building and it does not have screens and has the old style windows so they slide up and I had to put nails outside to hold the screen in close to the window. I used pool noodles to help keep the bugs out and keep it snug to the window as well. works perfect and also helps keep the cat from pushing it out. I liked the fact that this slides back and forth so its easy to collapse to take it in and out. This way I can open and close my window to what ever height I want not just the height of the screen itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Screening Not Completely Attached. The screening is very poorly installed in frame. It is puckered in parts where it is attached but about half of the screening is completely unattached to the frame, rendering it useless. So I’ve given it the lowest possible rating, except on installation, because I suppose if you wanted to install it in a window it would be easy. Except for propping a window open, it’s not going to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not 18 inches
customer_reviews.text: For quality, I would give it 5 stars, For the price, for any price, this is a very well made window screen. The reason for only 2 stars is that it isn't 18 inches high but only 17.5 and that is just enough too small to either fall out the window or leave gaps for the bugs to come in. What good is a screen that doesn't keep biting bugs out or worse pops out when the cat leans on it. Nice screen, just not the size it's suppose to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Williams

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the best quality, but given the price paid for them, they are proper quality. They adjust easy and are the correct dimension ordered. Works well for once in a while use. Will see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: D Patton

customer_reviews.title: I Should have bought one "Made In North Korea"!
customer_reviews.text: The flimsy screen arrived with the screen material partially separated from the frame. The frame itself seems unstable. Very poor quality all around. I contacted Amazon, but they told me to contact Frost Queen. Frosty Queen told me to go to the Post Office and arrange to ship it back. It would have cost me more in time and postage than it would have to purchase another one.😊 Frosty King refused to give me a refund. Really cold!! 🥶
customer_reviews.author: Frosty The Snowman

customer_reviews.title: Decent Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased about 4 of these screens, I live in an older house that I don't want to pay for specialty made screens at this time and these have been great temporary replacements, easy to use and fairly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nkwu

product_meta.title: WB Marvin Frost King AWS1545 Adjustable Window Screen, 15in High x Fits 25-45in Wide
product_meta.description:
Size Name:15in High x Fits 25-45in WideFrost King WB Marvin AWS1545 Adjustable Window Screen, 15in High x Fits 25-45in Wide

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Adjustable metal rail screens keep out flying insects and night bugs. Easy fingertip adjustment to fit all sash windows. Attractive bright mesh screen wire, galvanized rails and varnished wood ends with extra sturdy tenoned corners, double nailed to keep screen square. The affordable alternative to custom screens.
feature_bullets: Fingertip adjustment to fit all sash windows
Coated metal screen resists tear, weather, and keeps flying bugs out
Durable construction painted metal rails and varnished wood ends
An excellent new or replacement screen

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,775 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
